revisions.rev:
An absence or active rejection of [[violence]] in one's words, thoughts, and/or deeds. Often based on personal ethics or [[religion | religious]] or spiritual convictions. [[Martin Luther King, Jr.]], [[Dorothy Day]], [[Cesar Chavez]] and [[Mohandas K. Gandhi]] are often cited as great theorists of nonviolence and leaders of nonviolent social movements.
See [[pacifism]], [[Civil disobedience]], [[Civil and social disobedience]], and [[satyagraha]].
